thread.title: Greek PM Tsipras tells cabinet to intensify efforts ahead of bailout exit

title: Greek PM Tsipras tells cabinet to intensify efforts ahead of bailout exit
text:
April 3, 2018 / 9:39 AM / Updated an hour ago Greek PM Tsipras tells cabinet to intensify efforts ahead of bailout exit Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ATHENS (Reuters) - Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras urged his ministers on Tuesday to intensify reform efforts ahead of an anticipated conclusion of a three-year bailout program in August. Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras talks to media arrives at a European Union leaders summit in Brussels, Belgium, March 22, 2018. REUTERS/Francois Lenoir 
“There is no time for complacency but we must intensify efforts to finish the marathon,” he told a meeting of his cabinet. 
Tsipras reiterated that Greece sought a ‘clean exit’ from the bailout program. Reporting By George Georgiopoulos
